activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell James Kellogg

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:52 AM 21CT21,22CM05, 22CM57 - Defendant Mitchell James Kellogg in court.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court for Mitchell James Kellogg.  Attorney Harper on behalf of Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Anderson informs the court that they received an offer but his client doesn't have his licensed back. MK states that he needs to get the SR-22 insurance. Attorney Anderson asks for a reset of this case for 45 days. Court speaks about the age of this case and notes that if nothing changes by the next hearing then something need to happen with theses cases.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

4:07 PM 2022CM000005, 2022CM000057, 2021CT000021 -  Defendant Mitchell James Kellogg in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court for Mitchell James Kellogg. Attorney Anderson waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea on all cases. Parties asks for a status on all cases.
Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
For Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

While the case is pending, Defendant to pay $100 every two week to the Clerk of Court, first payment due 07/01/22. At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk
Plea hearing on June 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

1:56 PM 2022CM000005, 2022CM000057, 2021CT000021 - Defendant Mitchell James Kellogg in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. MK has received all three complaints. Court goes over the complaints with him on 22CM57. MK states that he can't get a public defender. Court speaks about dean counsel. 
02:33 PM Court goes over application with MK for dean appointment. 

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Anderson. Defendant to deposit $100 every two weeks with the Clerk of Court starting on   . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court.
Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:30 PM 21CT21/22CM05 - Defendant Mitchell James Kellogg appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. MK updates the court on the status of getting his DL. Court reset.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:17 PM Defendant Mitchell James Kellogg appeared by video means. Prosecuting Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. MK has received the complaint. Attorney Forehand comments about getting a valid DL. Court asks the defendant what it would take to get his DL. MK comments.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
